titles.title: Providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 1371) strongly condemning the Biden Administration and its Border Czar, Kamala Harris's, failure to secure the United States border.
Providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 1371) strongly condemning the Biden Administration and its Border Czar, Kamala Harris's, failure to secure the United States border.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 118-607, by Mr. Reschenthaler.
The resolution provides for consideration of H. Res. 1371 under a closed rule.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 86.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1376.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 1376, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 208 - 195 (Roll no. 391).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 210 - 202 (Roll no. 392).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: This resolution provides for consideration of H. Res. 1371 (condemning the Biden Administrationâ€™s border policies).
